events.name: GDG Monrovia Study Jam - Mobile Web Certification
events.description:
• What we'll do
A community study event - study jam, this time focused on web technologies, with concentration in mobile sites certification for the month of February-April.
The month of May will see us taking a peak behind the curtain of working with Google Cloud.
The goal is to support as many people as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community.

• What to bring
Laptop, Maybe some writing material and Yes a Game Face :)

• Important to know
This meetup is aimed at introducing beginners into the world of Mobile Web as well as helping them get certified.

Thus, Participants will require a gmail and github.com account to participate

- Participants will require a gmail and github account to participate

- Participants will need to pass a prerequisite test to prove the have the necessary knowledge. Please take the test for the Mobile Web Certification Study Jam at this link -> https://github.com/gdgmonrovia/Studyjam, hint *problem.md*, follow instructions listed in the repository.

- Registration forms will be made available in due course, with dates & location.

- Google cloud study jam dates will be communicated later.

events.name: IWD-Ladies In Tech: Meetup 1.0
events.description:
• What we'll do
Ladies In Tech is a subset that was created to aid the Women Techmakers in supporting and motivating young ladies who are interested in technology but have no skills whatsoever. It dares to provide the support and training in helping ladies move from zero to hero. We connect ladies to actual female techmakers in the industry to help them grow their core skills area.

• What to bring
Pen, Noteboo, Laptop

•Target Audience
You are beginning your career as a young lady or having interest in a tech field and looking to develop your interest and build your network.
-Exploring career paths in tech and listening from industry experts
-Access exclusive opportunities for skill development
-Learn best practices to help you position yourself for success in your field of interest

• Important to know
For further information contact GDG Monrovia Organizer (Christian Emenike) on[masked]/[masked]

events.name: GDG Mobile Web Study Group
events.description:
• What we'll do
Google Developers Groups Study Jams is a free series of global, community-run, in-person study groups. The second Study Jams series is presented in partnership with Udacity and will follow their Android Beginners curriculum. Google Developer Group facilitators certified in the course will lead the Study Jams that meet once weekly for 4-5 weeks.

In summary, the Mobile Site Certificate is :
A professional accreditation that Google offers
Aimed at demonstrating an understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development
You need basic web development skills to take part
Takes about 3-4 hours + 90 minute exam

To be part of the study group, kindly register: https://goo.gl/forms/rWpEY8hQp2G2gqWA3

• What to bring
PEN, NOTEBOOK ,LAPTOP

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: You can reach us on +231770538190/+231880538190 if you need directions

events.name: IWD Monrovia 2018 - Ladies In Tech: Meetup 2.0
events.description:
• What we'll do
Ladies In Tech is a subset created to aid the Women Techmakers in supporting and motivating young ladies interested in technology, that currently have no skills or access to training opportunities and materials in Liberia. As apart of our ongoing celebration of empowerment in technology, this will be our second edition dedicated to providing information, opportunities and helping ladies build their confidence in technology in Liberia.

Ladies in Tech strives to become a change maker; to provide the support and training that will help these ladies move from tech zeroes to tech heroes. Further, this event will connect ladies to actual Liberian female techmakers in the industry who will help them understand and see firsthand the possibilities of growth and success in their interested area.

In an effort to combat gender inequalities in technology, we hope to address challenges and steer up interest in the next generation of Women in technology, especially in the new age of Mobile and Web Development.

• What to bring
Pen, Notebook, Laptop, Cheerful Smile

•Target Audience
This event is purely targeted at beginners and interested newbies who are seeking guidance into technology.

-Exploring career paths in tech and listening from industry experts
-Access exclusive opportunities for skill development
-Learn best practices to help you position yourself for success in your field of interest

• Important to know
For further information contact GDG Monrovia Organizer (Christian Emenike) on[masked]/[masked]

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Monrovia
events.description:
Google I/O is Google's yearly Developer Conference -and at Google I/O 2018 (https://events.google.com/io/) we are expected to learn about new and interesting things from Google, interesting for us developers, IT geeks and techies.

Expected Agenda (GDG Monrovia)
1. Getting Started - What is Firebase(45 mins)
2. Python Crash Course: (3 hours)
3. Getting Started - What is App Engine (1hour)
4. Coding (2 hours)
5. Introduction to UrlFetch and Mail APIs (15mins)
6. Coding (1.5hours)
7. Introduction to Images & Memecache + Coding (1.25 hours)
8. Attendees present the apps they worked on /wrap up

Details

A Google I/O extended (https://events.google.com/io/extended/) event is an extension of the event, a great opportunity to get together, chat, listen to the keynotes, discuss further. Google I/O Extended are taking place across the globe, at the same time or around the time of Google I/O.

Of course GDG Monrovia (#gdgmonrovia) isn't left out. We shall do the same!

Come and join us for our Google I/O extended on the first day of Google I/O, May 8 (the whole conference runs May 8-10, but we shall be having code session during the evening period ).

Schedule:
TUESDAY May 8
(9:00PM): KeyNote Presentation
(11:00PM): CodeLab & Sandboxing

WEDNESDAY
(06:00AM): Breakfast
(07:00PM): CodeLab & Sandboxing

THURSDAY
(6:00AM): Breakfast
Free Sandboxing

ATTENTION: You must reserve a space if you are sure to attend. Only registered participants will be allowed in. Strict policies will be applied.

Just like before we have a bunch of other activities planned so come and join us, learn more about GDG Monrovia, talk tech, and learn what news Google wants us to hear for 2018.

Space is limited, so make sure you sign up!

KEYNOTES starts by 9:00PM (YES! We shall be having a night session coding spree) - we will watch the live stream from Google I/O in Mountain View.

However we open the doors for the main event already at by 8:00PM.

BRING your laptop, we'll be going through some code labs and there will be time for questions (of course you can come just for the networking and I/O keynotes as well, if you don't feel like bringing the laptop.)

After the Keynotes there will be time to mingle, discuss what was presented in the keynotes from Google, and much more - of course we'll have both food and drinks (Hopefully).

Remember to keep your RSVP up to date - cancel your attendance if you cannot make it, so someone else can join instead.

NOTICE! We are still planning and preparing this event so information might be updated. Stay tuned!

This years Google I/O Extended is hosted by Easy Tech Solutions & Consultancy Inc in collaboration with Ehub Liberia & GDG Monorvia

So clear your schedule and get ready for some nerdy fun with likeminded people, we hope to see you here.

We will be serving food and drinks.
https://events.google.com/io/

Thanks to all our sponsors for making this event a great one. You guys are awesome.

- Participants will need to pass a prerequisite test to prove the have the necessary knowledge. Please take the test for the Mobile Web Certification Study Jam at this link -> https://github.com/gdgmonrovia/Studyjam, hint *problem.md*, follow instructions listed in the repository.

events.name: GDG Mobile Web Study Group
events.description:
• What we'll do
Google Developers Groups Study Jams is a free series of global, community-run, in-person study groups. The second Study Jams series is presented in partnership with Udacity and will follow their Android Beginners curriculum. Google Developer Group facilitators certified in the course will lead the Study Jams that meet once weekly for 4-5 weeks.

In summary, the Mobile Site Certificate is :
A professional accreditation that Google offers
Aimed at demonstrating an understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development
You need basic web development skills to take part
Takes about 3-4 hours + 90 minute exam

To be part of the study group, kindly register: https://goo.gl/forms/rWpEY8hQp2G2gqWA3

• What to bring
PEN, NOTEBOOK ,LAPTOP

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: You can reach us on +231770538190/+231880538190 if you need directions

events.name: GDG Monrovia Study Jam - Mobile Web Certification
events.description:
• What we'll do
A community study event - study jam, this time focused on web technologies, with concentration in mobile sites certification for the month of February-April.
The month of May will see us taking a peak behind the curtain of working with Google Cloud.
The goal is to support as many people as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community.

• What to bring
Laptop, Maybe some writing material and Yes a Game Face :)

• Important to know
This meetup is aimed at introducing beginners into the world of Mobile Web as well as helping them get certified.

Thus, Participants will require a gmail and github.com account to participate

- Participants will require a gmail and github account to participate

- Participants will need to pass a prerequisite test to prove the have the necessary knowledge. Please take the test for the Mobile Web Certification Study Jam at this link -> https://github.com/gdgmonrovia/Studyjam, hint *problem.md*, follow instructions listed in the repository.

- Registration forms will be made available in due course, with dates & location.

- Google cloud study jam dates will be communicated later.

events.name: DevFest Monrovia
events.description:
*VERY IMPORTANT READ*
GDG Monrovia is pleased to announce our #DevFest18. This is our first edition of the long-standing #DevFest Tradition where developers from all walks of life, showcase what they have been up to in the year. It's a season of collaboration with other community members.

Talks and Demos randing from #Web, #Firebase, #Andriod, #ML, #IoT and any in between.

Registration is now open to all new and existing #GDGMonrovia Community member.

We are keeping this year event small. Sign up now and secure your space.

Would you like to speak or present at the event, Reach out to us [masked]

Would you like to speak at the event? Then fill this form http://bit.ly/2TkzVws

COMING SOON - The DevFest and GDGMonrovia Website.

events.name: GDG Monrovia Meetup
events.description:
1. Discussion on Building a striving & sustainable Tech Ecosystem
2. Launch of WomenTechMakers
3. Cloud Study Jam for the Month of March 2019

events.name: TensorFlow DevSummit 2019 (Viewing Party)
events.description:
1. Get a hand on tensor flow and its application to today's business
2. Access real-time information on the summit
3. Hangout with interested community members
events.how_to_find_us: Call 0880538190, 0770538190 to get specifics of the venue.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Monrovia
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: IWD Monrovia 2019
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2019 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

Tell a friend and come for inspirational talks, hands on codelabs, sandbox sessions, access to amazing communication building workshops and a customized networking experience.

We can't wait to see you there!

What to bring:
-Your Laptop
-A notebook and a Pen
-Excitement
-A friend!!!

Note:
The event is welcome to all.

10:00am Registration & Tea
11:00am Welcome Remarks
11:15am Keynote
11:40am Tech Talk/Panel Discussion
12:00pm Lunch & Networking
01:00pm Workshop Track 1: #IamRemarkable
02:00pm Workshop Track 2: Actions on Google
03:00pm Women Techmakers Spotlight
03:30pm Fireside Chat
03:45pm Lighting Talk
04:00pm Closing Remarks
04:15pm Reception

*subject to change

Register now to be part.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Monrovia v2
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: Read, Set, Flutter: Building Mobile Apps with Flutter
events.description:
# Summary
Flutter is a new mobile application development environment that allows you to build native apps that runs on Andriod and IOS using a single code based.

# About our Guest
Not your usual software developer, he loves getting out of the zone of comfort and if you don't see him at a tech event, he is probably organizing the next tech event for Google Developer Group Lisbon, that he is an organizer for the last last 3 years, where he organized more than 60 events, 4 of them being full-day conferences. He is always reading about psychology or supporting a local community to grow. He has a strong opinion about social impact, inclusivity and the importance of communities.

Lately, he has been advocating the new Flutter SDK by Google, around Portugal, by organizing Flutter Talks and workshops.

As a developer, he has worked in android applications for companies such as Altice, Brisa, Federação Portuguesa Futebol, TAP, Bayer among many others and currently is working remotely as an Android Developer and Machine Learning Engineer.

# Note: Only those who are highly interested in Mobile development are encourage to participate. Seats are very limited.

# To Do Action
Make sure you've these beforehand for the workshop
https://gist.github.com/OldMetalmind/ce8c2b1b8c758986685cda7005f66b9f

events.name: Kotlin Night Monrovia
events.description:
Kotlin Night is a meetup that includes 3-4 talks on Kotlin, its introduction and how it functions with related technologies.

This event is hosted by GDG Monrovia. Eminent Kotlin speakers will be speaking at this event.

You do not want to miss this, or do you? Sign up now.
events.how_to_find_us: Call 0880538190 or 0770538190 for direction to the location. Sorry, but space is limited

events.name: Google I/O '19 Extended - Monrovia
events.description:
Next ’19 Extended Monrovia is an extension of the main conference happening on the April 9-11, 2019 in San Francisco, CA. The local event will entail a recap of the Conference, talks, workshops and panels.

The main objective of the event is to increase awareness and engagement of developers of what they can leverage on Google Cloud Platform.

Hundreds of attendees. breakout sessions. One event like no other.

Come help us build a cloud for everyone.

organizers.name: Christian Emenike (.
organizers.bio: A Social-Entrepreneur, Software and Security Engineer, Open Source Evangelist and Religious Geek.

group_profile.intro: A Social-Community Builder, Software & Security Engineer

organizers.name: Jallah S.
organizers.bio: A practicing Full stack developer & software engineer with a deep passion for AI, ML, Data Science  and Cyber Security. I strongly believe these topics are interconnected and will create a unique chance for me to contribute greatly to the world.
